main.java.board

Interface IChessboard

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CircleBoard, SquareBoard

    public interface IChessboard
    Interface to manage the logical behaviors of any type of chessboard.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      ChessboardDisplay getDisplay() 
      King getKing(Player player)

    • Method Detail

      • getSquare

        Square getSquare(int x,
                 int y)
        Get the reference to the square for the given x and y integers after click
        Parameters:
        x - x position on the window
        y - y position on the window
        Returns:
        reference to searched square

      • select

        void select(Square sq)
        Select a Square in chessboard
        Parameters:
        sq - square to select (when clicked))

      • unselect

        void unselect()
        Set variables active_x_square and active_y_square to default values (-1).

      • getDisplay

        ChessboardDisplay getDisplay()
        Returns:
        ChesboardDisplay Object of the Chessboard.

      • setPieces

        void setPieces(Player[] players)
        Set the initial configuration of the pieces before the game for the given set of players.
        Parameters:
        players - Array of players of the game

      • getSquares

        Square[][] getSquares()
        Returns:
        two dimensional array of Squares of the Chessboard

      • move

        void move(Square begin,
          Square end)
        Move piece from a square to a different one
        Parameters:
        begin - square from which move piece
        end - square where we want to move piece

      • undo

        boolean undo()

      • redo

        boolean redo()

      • getActiveSquare

        Square getActiveSquare()
        Returns:
        selected square of the Chessboard

      • getKing

        King getKing(Player player)
        Parameters:
        player - given player whose King is requested
        Returns:
        King of the same color of the given player, null if the color is not found
